00019 #define BOOST_FUNCTION_TEMPLATE_PARMS BOOST_PP_ENUM_PARAMS(BOOST_FUNCTION_NUM_ARGS, typename T)
00020 
00021 #define BOOST_FUNCTION_TEMPLATE_ARGS BOOST_PP_ENUM_PARAMS(BOOST_FUNCTION_NUM_ARGS, T)
00022 
00023 #define BOOST_FUNCTION_PARM(J,I,D) BOOST_PP_CAT(T,I) BOOST_PP_CAT(a,I)
00024 
00025 #define BOOST_FUNCTION_PARMS BOOST_PP_ENUM(BOOST_FUNCTION_NUM_ARGS,BOOST_FUNCTION_PARM,BOOST_PP_EMPTY)
00026 
00027 #define BOOST_FUNCTION_ARGS BOOST_PP_ENUM_PARAMS(BOOST_FUNCTION_NUM_ARGS, a)
00028 
00029 #define BOOST_FUNCTION_ARG_TYPE(J,I,D) \
00030   typedef BOOST_PP_CAT(T,I) BOOST_PP_CAT(BOOST_PP_CAT(arg, BOOST_PP_INC(I)),_type);
00031 
00032 #define BOOST_FUNCTION_ARG_TYPES BOOST_PP_REPEAT(BOOST_FUNCTION_NUM_ARGS,BOOST_FUNCTION_ARG_TYPE,BOOST_PP_EMPTY)

00034 // Type of the default allocator
00035 #ifndef BOOST_NO_STD_ALLOCATOR
00036 #  define BOOST_FUNCTION_DEFAULT_ALLOCATOR std::allocator<function_base>
00037 #else
00038 #  define BOOST_FUNCTION_DEFAULT_ALLOCATOR int
00039 #endif // BOOST_NO_STD_ALLOCATOR

00041 // Comma if nonzero number of arguments
00042 #if BOOST_FUNCTION_NUM_ARGS == 0
00043 #  define BOOST_FUNCTION_COMMA
00044 #else
00045 #  define BOOST_FUNCTION_COMMA ,
00046 #endif // BOOST_FUNCTION_NUM_ARGS > 0

00049 #define BOOST_FUNCTION_FUNCTION BOOST_JOIN(function,BOOST_FUNCTION_NUM_ARGS)
00050 #define BOOST_FUNCTION_FUNCTION_INVOKER \
00051   BOOST_JOIN(function_invoker,BOOST_FUNCTION_NUM_ARGS)

00078 #ifndef BOOST_NO_VOID_RETURNS

00080 #  define BOOST_FUNCTION_RETURN(X) X
00081 #else
00082 #  define BOOST_FUNCTION_VOID_RETURN_TYPE boost::detail::function::unusable
00083 #  define BOOST_FUNCTION_RETURN(X) X; return BOOST_FUNCTION_VOID_RETURN_TYPE ()

00086 namespace boost {

00089       template<
00090         typename FunctionPtr,
00091         typename R BOOST_FUNCTION_COMMA
00092         BOOST_FUNCTION_TEMPLATE_PARMS
00093         >
00094       struct BOOST_FUNCTION_FUNCTION_INVOKER
00095       {
00096         static R invoke(function_buffer& function_ptr BOOST_FUNCTION_COMMA
00097                         BOOST_FUNCTION_PARMS)
00098         {
00099           FunctionPtr f = reinterpret_cast<FunctionPtr>(function_ptr.func_ptr);
00100           return f(BOOST_FUNCTION_ARGS);
00101         }
00102       };
00103 
00104       template<
00105         typename FunctionPtr,
00106         typename R BOOST_FUNCTION_COMMA
00107         BOOST_FUNCTION_TEMPLATE_PARMS
00108         >
00109       struct BOOST_FUNCTION_VOID_FUNCTION_INVOKER
00110       {
00111         static BOOST_FUNCTION_VOID_RETURN_TYPE
00112         invoke(function_buffer& function_ptr BOOST_FUNCTION_COMMA
00113                BOOST_FUNCTION_PARMS)
00114 
00115         {
00116           FunctionPtr f = reinterpret_cast<FunctionPtr>(function_ptr.func_ptr);
00117           BOOST_FUNCTION_RETURN(f(BOOST_FUNCTION_ARGS));
00118         }
00119       };
00120 
00121       template<
00122         typename FunctionObj,
00123         typename R BOOST_FUNCTION_COMMA
00124         BOOST_FUNCTION_TEMPLATE_PARMS
00125       >
00126       struct BOOST_FUNCTION_FUNCTION_OBJ_INVOKER
00127       {
00128         static R invoke(function_buffer& function_obj_ptr BOOST_FUNCTION_COMMA
00129                         BOOST_FUNCTION_PARMS)
00130 
00131         {
00132           FunctionObj* f;
00133           if (function_allows_small_object_optimization<FunctionObj>::value)
00134             f = reinterpret_cast<FunctionObj*>(&function_obj_ptr.data);
00135           else
00136             f = reinterpret_cast<FunctionObj*>(function_obj_ptr.obj_ptr);
00137           return (*f)(BOOST_FUNCTION_ARGS);
00138         }
00139       };
00140 
00141       template<
00142         typename FunctionObj,
00143         typename R BOOST_FUNCTION_COMMA
00144         BOOST_FUNCTION_TEMPLATE_PARMS
00145       >
00146       struct BOOST_FUNCTION_VOID_FUNCTION_OBJ_INVOKER
00147       {
00148         static BOOST_FUNCTION_VOID_RETURN_TYPE
00149         invoke(function_buffer& function_obj_ptr BOOST_FUNCTION_COMMA
00150                BOOST_FUNCTION_PARMS)
00151 
00152         {
00153           FunctionObj* f;
00154           if (function_allows_small_object_optimization<FunctionObj>::value)
00155             f = reinterpret_cast<FunctionObj*>(&function_obj_ptr.data);
00156           else
00157             f = reinterpret_cast<FunctionObj*>(function_obj_ptr.obj_ptr);
00158           BOOST_FUNCTION_RETURN((*f)(BOOST_FUNCTION_ARGS));
00159         }
00160       };

00204       struct BOOST_FUNCTION_MEMBER_INVOKER

00321 
00322       /* Given the tag returned by get_function_tag, retrieve the
00323          actual invoker that will be used for the given function
00324          object. 
00325 
00326          Each specialization contains an "apply" nested class template
00327          that accepts the function object, return type, function
00328          argument types, and allocator. The resulting "apply" class
00329          contains two typedefs, "invoker_type" and "manager_type",
00330          which correspond to the invoker and manager types. */
00331       template<typename Tag>
00332       struct BOOST_FUNCTION_GET_INVOKER { };
00333 
00334       /* Retrieve the invoker for a function pointer. */
00335       template<>
00336       struct BOOST_FUNCTION_GET_INVOKER<function_ptr_tag>
00337       {
00338         template<typename FunctionPtr,
00339                  typename R BOOST_FUNCTION_COMMA BOOST_FUNCTION_TEMPLATE_PARMS,
00340                  typename Allocator>
00341         struct apply
00342         {
00343           typedef typename BOOST_FUNCTION_GET_FUNCTION_INVOKER<
00344                              FunctionPtr,
00345                              R BOOST_FUNCTION_COMMA
00346                              BOOST_FUNCTION_TEMPLATE_ARGS
00347                            >::type
00348             invoker_type;
00349 
00350           typedef functor_manager<FunctionPtr, Allocator> manager_type;
00351         };
00352       };
00353 
00354 #if BOOST_FUNCTION_NUM_ARGS > 0
00355       /* Retrieve the invoker for a member pointer. */
00356       template<>
00357       struct BOOST_FUNCTION_GET_INVOKER<member_ptr_tag>
00358       {
00359         template<typename MemberPtr,
00360                  typename R BOOST_FUNCTION_COMMA BOOST_FUNCTION_TEMPLATE_PARMS,
00361                  typename Allocator>
00362         struct apply
00363         {
00364           typedef typename BOOST_FUNCTION_GET_MEMBER_INVOKER<
00365                              MemberPtr,
00366                              R BOOST_FUNCTION_COMMA
00367                              BOOST_FUNCTION_TEMPLATE_ARGS
00368                            >::type
00369             invoker_type;
00370 
00371           typedef functor_manager<MemberPtr, Allocator> manager_type;
00372         };
00373       };
00374 #endif
00375 
00376       /* Retrieve the invoker for a function object. */
00377       template<>
00378       struct BOOST_FUNCTION_GET_INVOKER<function_obj_tag>
00379       {
00380         template<typename FunctionObj,
00381                  typename R BOOST_FUNCTION_COMMA BOOST_FUNCTION_TEMPLATE_PARMS,
00382                  typename Allocator>
00383         struct apply
00384         {
00385           typedef typename BOOST_FUNCTION_GET_FUNCTION_OBJ_INVOKER<
00386                              FunctionObj,
00387                              R BOOST_FUNCTION_COMMA
00388                              BOOST_FUNCTION_TEMPLATE_ARGS
00389                            >::type
00390             invoker_type;
00391 
00392           typedef functor_manager<FunctionObj, Allocator> manager_type;
00393         };
00394       };
00395 
00396       /* Retrieve the invoker for a reference to a function object. */
00397       template<>
00398       struct BOOST_FUNCTION_GET_INVOKER<function_obj_ref_tag>
00399       {
00400         template<typename RefWrapper,
00401                  typename R BOOST_FUNCTION_COMMA BOOST_FUNCTION_TEMPLATE_PARMS,
00402                  typename Allocator>
00403         struct apply
00404         {
00405           typedef typename BOOST_FUNCTION_GET_FUNCTION_REF_INVOKER<
00406                              typename RefWrapper::type,
00407                              R BOOST_FUNCTION_COMMA
00408                              BOOST_FUNCTION_TEMPLATE_ARGS
00409                            >::type
00410             invoker_type;
00411 
00412           typedef reference_manager<typename RefWrapper::type> manager_type;
00413         };
00414       };
00415 
00419       template<typename R BOOST_FUNCTION_COMMA BOOST_FUNCTION_TEMPLATE_PARMS,
00420                typename Allocator>
00421       struct BOOST_FUNCTION_VTABLE
00422       {
00423 #ifndef BOOST_NO_VOID_RETURNS
00424         typedef R         result_type;
00425 #else
00426         typedef typename function_return_type<R>::type result_type;
00427 #endif // BOOST_NO_VOID_RETURNS
00428 
00429         typedef result_type (*invoker_type)(function_buffer&
00430                                             BOOST_FUNCTION_COMMA
00431                                             BOOST_FUNCTION_TEMPLATE_ARGS);
00432 
00433         template<typename F>
00434         bool assign_to(const F& f, function_buffer& functor) const
00435         {
00436           typedef typename get_function_tag<F>::type tag;
00437           return assign_to(f, functor, tag());
00438         }
00439 
00440         void clear(function_buffer& functor) const
00441         {
00442           if (base.manager)
00443             base.manager(functor, functor, destroy_functor_tag);
00444         }
00445 #ifndef BOOST_NO_PRIVATE_IN_AGGREGATE
00446       private:
00447 #endif
00448         // Function pointers
00449         template<typename FunctionPtr>
00450         bool 
00451         assign_to(FunctionPtr f, function_buffer& functor, 
00452                   function_ptr_tag) const
00453         {
00454           this->clear(functor);
00455           if (f) {
00456             // should be a reinterpret cast, but some compilers insist
00457             // on giving cv-qualifiers to free functions
00458             functor.func_ptr = (void (*)())(f);
00459             return true;
00460           } else {
00461             return false;
00462           }
00463         }
00464 
00465         // Member pointers
00466 #if BOOST_FUNCTION_NUM_ARGS > 0
00467         template<typename MemberPtr>
00468         bool 
00469         assign_to(MemberPtr f, function_buffer& functor, member_ptr_tag) const
00470         {
00471           if (f) {
00472             // Always use the small-object optimization for member
00473             // pointers.
00474             assign_functor(f, functor, mpl::true_());
00475             return true;
00476           } else {
00477             return false;
00478           }
00479         }
00480 #endif // BOOST_FUNCTION_NUM_ARGS > 0
00481 
00482         // Function objects
00483         // Assign to a function object using the small object optimization
00484         template<typename FunctionObj>
00485         void 
00486         assign_functor(const FunctionObj& f, function_buffer& functor, 
00487                        mpl::true_) const
00488         {
00489           new ((void*)&functor.data) FunctionObj(f);
00490         }
00491 
00492         // Assign to a function object allocated on the heap.
00493         template<typename FunctionObj>
00494         void 
00495         assign_functor(const FunctionObj& f, function_buffer& functor, 
00496                        mpl::false_) const
00497         {
00498 #ifndef BOOST_NO_STD_ALLOCATOR
00499           typedef typename Allocator::template rebind<FunctionObj>::other
00500             allocator_type;
00501           typedef typename allocator_type::pointer pointer_type;
00502 
00503           allocator_type allocator;
00504           pointer_type copy = allocator.allocate(1);
00505           allocator.construct(copy, f);
00506 
00507           // Get back to the original pointer type
00508           functor.obj_ptr = static_cast<FunctionObj*>(copy);
00509 #  else
00510           functor.obj_ptr = new FunctionObj(f);
00511 #  endif // BOOST_NO_STD_ALLOCATOR
00512         }
00513 
00514         template<typename FunctionObj>
00515         bool 
00516         assign_to(const FunctionObj& f, function_buffer& functor, 
00517                   function_obj_tag) const
00518         {
00519           if (!boost::detail::function::has_empty_target(boost::addressof(f))) {
00520             assign_functor(f, functor, 
00521                            mpl::bool_<(function_allows_small_object_optimization<FunctionObj>::value)>());
00522             return true;
00523           } else {
00524             return false;
00525           }
00526         }
00527 
00528         // Reference to a function object
00529         template<typename FunctionObj>
00530         bool 
00531         assign_to(const reference_wrapper<FunctionObj>& f, 
00532                   function_buffer& functor, function_obj_ref_tag) const
00533         {
00534           if (!boost::detail::function::has_empty_target(f.get_pointer())) {
00535             // DPG TBD: We might need to detect constness of
00536             // FunctionObj to assign into obj_ptr or const_obj_ptr to
00537             // be truly legit, but no platform in existence makes
00538             // const void* different from void*.
00539             functor.const_obj_ptr = f.get_pointer();
00540             return true;
00541           } else {
00542             return false;
00543           }
00544         }
00545 
00546       public:
00547         vtable_base base;
00548         invoker_type invoker;
00549       };
00550     } // end namespace function
00551   } // end namespace detail
00552 
00553   template<
00554     typename R BOOST_FUNCTION_COMMA
00555     BOOST_FUNCTION_TEMPLATE_PARMS,
00556     typename Allocator = BOOST_FUNCTION_DEFAULT_ALLOCATOR
00557   >
00558   class BOOST_FUNCTION_FUNCTION : public function_base
00559 
00560 #if BOOST_FUNCTION_NUM_ARGS == 1
00561 
00562     , public std::unary_function<T0,R>
00563 
00564 #elif BOOST_FUNCTION_NUM_ARGS == 2
00565 
00566     , public std::binary_function<T0,T1,R>
00567 
00568 #endif
00569 
00570   {
00571   public:
00572 #ifndef BOOST_NO_VOID_RETURNS
00573     typedef R         result_type;
00574 #else
00575     typedef  typename boost::detail::function::function_return_type<R>::type
00576       result_type;
00577 #endif // BOOST_NO_VOID_RETURNS
00578 
00579   private:
00580     typedef boost::detail::function::BOOST_FUNCTION_VTABLE<
00581               R BOOST_FUNCTION_COMMA BOOST_FUNCTION_TEMPLATE_ARGS, Allocator>
00582       vtable_type;
00583 
00584     struct clear_type {};
00585 
00586   public:
00587     BOOST_STATIC_CONSTANT(int, args = BOOST_FUNCTION_NUM_ARGS);
00588 
00589     // add signature for boost::lambda
00590     template<typename Args>
00591     struct sig
00592     {
00593       typedef result_type type;
00594     };
00595 
00596 #if BOOST_FUNCTION_NUM_ARGS == 1
00597     typedef T0 argument_type;
00598 #elif BOOST_FUNCTION_NUM_ARGS == 2
00599     typedef T0 first_argument_type;
00600     typedef T1 second_argument_type;
00601 #endif
00602 
00603     BOOST_STATIC_CONSTANT(int, arity = BOOST_FUNCTION_NUM_ARGS);
00604     BOOST_FUNCTION_ARG_TYPES
00605 
00606     typedef Allocator allocator_type;
00607     typedef BOOST_FUNCTION_FUNCTION self_type;
00608 
00609     BOOST_FUNCTION_FUNCTION() : function_base() { }
00610 
00611     // MSVC chokes if the following two constructors are collapsed into
00612     // one with a default parameter.
00613     template<typename Functor>
00614     BOOST_FUNCTION_FUNCTION(Functor BOOST_FUNCTION_TARGET_FIX(const &) f
00615 #ifndef BOOST_NO_SFINAE
00616                             ,typename enable_if_c<
00617                             (boost::type_traits::ice_not<
00618                              (is_integral<Functor>::value)>::value),
00619                                         int>::type = 0
00620 #endif // BOOST_NO_SFINAE
00621                             ) :
00622       function_base()
00623     {
00624       this->assign_to(f);
00625     }
00626 
00627 #ifndef BOOST_NO_SFINAE
00628     BOOST_FUNCTION_FUNCTION(clear_type*) : function_base() { }
00629 #else
00630     BOOST_FUNCTION_FUNCTION(int zero) : function_base()
00631     {
00632       BOOST_ASSERT(zero == 0);
00633     }
00634 #endif
00635 
00636     BOOST_FUNCTION_FUNCTION(const BOOST_FUNCTION_FUNCTION& f) : function_base()
00637     {
00638       this->assign_to_own(f);
00639     }
00640 
00641     ~BOOST_FUNCTION_FUNCTION() { clear(); }
00642 
00643 #if BOOST_WORKAROUND(BOOST_MSVC, < 1300)
00644     // MSVC 6.0 and prior require all definitions to be inline, but
00645     // these definitions can become very costly.
00646     result_type operator()(BOOST_FUNCTION_PARMS) const
00647     {
00648       if (this->empty())
00649         boost::throw_exception(bad_function_call());
00650 
00651       return reinterpret_cast<const vtable_type*>(vtable)->invoker
00652                (this->functor BOOST_FUNCTION_COMMA BOOST_FUNCTION_ARGS);
00653     }
00654 #else
00655     result_type operator()(BOOST_FUNCTION_PARMS) const;
00656 #endif
00657 
00658     // The distinction between when to use BOOST_FUNCTION_FUNCTION and
00659     // when to use self_type is obnoxious. MSVC cannot handle self_type as
00660     // the return type of these assignment operators, but Borland C++ cannot
00661     // handle BOOST_FUNCTION_FUNCTION as the type of the temporary to
00662     // construct.
00663     template<typename Functor>
00664 #ifndef BOOST_NO_SFINAE
00665     typename enable_if_c<
00666                (boost::type_traits::ice_not<
00667                  (is_integral<Functor>::value)>::value),
00668                BOOST_FUNCTION_FUNCTION&>::type
00669 #else
00670     BOOST_FUNCTION_FUNCTION&
00671 #endif
00672     operator=(Functor BOOST_FUNCTION_TARGET_FIX(const &) f)
00673     {
00674       this->clear();
00675 #ifndef BOOST_NO_EXCEPTIONS
00676       try {
00677         this->assign_to(f);
00678       } catch (...) {
00679         vtable = 0;
00680         throw;
00681       }
00682 #else
00683       this->assign_to(f);
00684 #endif
00685       return *this;
00686     }
00687 
00688 #ifndef BOOST_NO_SFINAE
00689     BOOST_FUNCTION_FUNCTION& operator=(clear_type*)
00690     {
00691       this->clear();
00692       return *this;
00693     }
00694 #else
00695     BOOST_FUNCTION_FUNCTION& operator=(int zero)
00696     {
00697       BOOST_ASSERT(zero == 0);
00698       this->clear();
00699       return *this;
00700     }
00701 #endif
00702 
00703     // Assignment from another BOOST_FUNCTION_FUNCTION
00704     BOOST_FUNCTION_FUNCTION& operator=(const BOOST_FUNCTION_FUNCTION& f)
00705     {
00706       if (&f == this)
00707         return *this;
00708 
00709       this->clear();
00710 #ifndef BOOST_NO_EXCEPTIONS
00711       try {
00712         this->assign_to_own(f);
00713       } catch (...) {
00714         vtable = 0;
00715         throw;
00716       }
00717 #else
00718       this->assign_to_own(f);
00719 #endif
00720       return *this;
00721     }
00722 
00723     void swap(BOOST_FUNCTION_FUNCTION& other)
00724     {
00725       if (&other == this)
00726         return;
00727 
00728       BOOST_FUNCTION_FUNCTION tmp = *this;
00729       *this = other;
00730       other = tmp;
00731     }
00732 
00733     // Clear out a target, if there is one
00734     void clear()
00735     {
00736       if (vtable) {
00737         reinterpret_cast<const vtable_type*>(vtable)->clear(this->functor);
00738         vtable = 0;
00739       }
00740     }
00741 
00742 #if (defined __SUNPRO_CC) && (__SUNPRO_CC <= 0x530) && !(defined BOOST_NO_COMPILER_CONFIG)
00743     // Sun C++ 5.3 can't handle the safe_bool idiom, so don't use it
00744     operator bool () const { return !this->empty(); }
00745 #else
00746   private:
00747     struct dummy {
00748       void nonnull() {};
00749     };
00750 
00751     typedef void (dummy::*safe_bool)();
00752 
00753   public:
00754     operator safe_bool () const
00755       { return (this->empty())? 0 : &dummy::nonnull; }
00756 
00757     bool operator!() const
00758       { return this->empty(); }
00759 #endif
00760 
00761   private:
00762     void assign_to_own(const BOOST_FUNCTION_FUNCTION& f)
00763     {
00764       if (!f.empty()) {
00765         this->vtable = f.vtable;
00766         f.vtable->manager(f.functor, this->functor,
00767                           boost::detail::function::clone_functor_tag);
00768       }
00769     }
00770 
00771     template<typename Functor>
00772     void assign_to(const Functor& f)
00773     {
00774       using detail::function::vtable_base;
00775 
00776       typedef typename detail::function::get_function_tag<Functor>::type tag;
00777       typedef detail::function::BOOST_FUNCTION_GET_INVOKER<tag> get_invoker;
00778       typedef typename get_invoker::
00779                          template apply<Functor, R BOOST_FUNCTION_COMMA 
00780                         BOOST_FUNCTION_TEMPLATE_ARGS, Allocator>
00781         handler_type;
00782       
00783       typedef typename handler_type::invoker_type invoker_type;
00784       typedef typename handler_type::manager_type manager_type;
00785       
00786       static const vtable_type stored_vtable = 
00787         { { &manager_type::manage }, &invoker_type::invoke };
00788 
00789       if (stored_vtable.assign_to(f, functor)) vtable = &stored_vtable.base;
00790       else vtable = 0;
00791     }
00792   };
00793 
00794   template<typename R BOOST_FUNCTION_COMMA BOOST_FUNCTION_TEMPLATE_PARMS ,
00795            typename Allocator>
00796   inline void swap(BOOST_FUNCTION_FUNCTION<
00797                      R BOOST_FUNCTION_COMMA
00798                      BOOST_FUNCTION_TEMPLATE_ARGS ,
00799                      Allocator
00800                    >& f1,
00801                    BOOST_FUNCTION_FUNCTION<
00802                      R BOOST_FUNCTION_COMMA
00803                      BOOST_FUNCTION_TEMPLATE_ARGS,
00804                      Allocator
00805                    >& f2)
00806   {
00807     f1.swap(f2);
00808   }
00809 
00810 #if !BOOST_WORKAROUND(BOOST_MSVC, < 1300)
00811   template<typename R BOOST_FUNCTION_COMMA BOOST_FUNCTION_TEMPLATE_PARMS,
00812            typename Allocator>
00813   typename BOOST_FUNCTION_FUNCTION<
00814       R BOOST_FUNCTION_COMMA BOOST_FUNCTION_TEMPLATE_ARGS,
00815       Allocator>::result_type
00816    BOOST_FUNCTION_FUNCTION<R BOOST_FUNCTION_COMMA BOOST_FUNCTION_TEMPLATE_ARGS,
00817 
00818                            Allocator>
00819   ::operator()(BOOST_FUNCTION_PARMS) const
00820   {
00821     if (this->empty())
00822       boost::throw_exception(bad_function_call());
00823 
00824     return reinterpret_cast<const vtable_type*>(vtable)->invoker
00825              (this->functor BOOST_FUNCTION_COMMA BOOST_FUNCTION_ARGS);
00826   }
00827 #endif
00828 
00829 // Poison comparisons between boost::function objects of the same type.
00830 template<typename R BOOST_FUNCTION_COMMA BOOST_FUNCTION_TEMPLATE_PARMS ,
00831          typename Allocator>
00832   void operator==(const BOOST_FUNCTION_FUNCTION<
00833                           R BOOST_FUNCTION_COMMA
00834                           BOOST_FUNCTION_TEMPLATE_ARGS ,
00835                           Allocator>&,
00836                   const BOOST_FUNCTION_FUNCTION<
00837                           R BOOST_FUNCTION_COMMA
00838                           BOOST_FUNCTION_TEMPLATE_ARGS ,
00839                   Allocator>&);
00840 template<typename R BOOST_FUNCTION_COMMA BOOST_FUNCTION_TEMPLATE_PARMS ,
00841          typename Allocator>
00842   void operator!=(const BOOST_FUNCTION_FUNCTION<
00843                           R BOOST_FUNCTION_COMMA
00844                           BOOST_FUNCTION_TEMPLATE_ARGS ,
00845                           Allocator>&,
00846                   const BOOST_FUNCTION_FUNCTION<
00847                           R BOOST_FUNCTION_COMMA
00848                           BOOST_FUNCTION_TEMPLATE_ARGS ,
00849                   Allocator>&);
00850 
00851 #if !defined(BOOST_FUNCTION_NO_FUNCTION_TYPE_SYNTAX)
00852 
00853 #if BOOST_FUNCTION_NUM_ARGS == 0
00854 #define BOOST_FUNCTION_PARTIAL_SPEC R (void)
00855 #else
00856 #define BOOST_FUNCTION_PARTIAL_SPEC R (BOOST_PP_ENUM_PARAMS(BOOST_FUNCTION_NUM_ARGS,T))
00857 #endif
00858 
00859 template<typename R BOOST_FUNCTION_COMMA
00860          BOOST_FUNCTION_TEMPLATE_PARMS,
00861          typename Allocator>
00862 class function<BOOST_FUNCTION_PARTIAL_SPEC, Allocator>
00863   : public BOOST_FUNCTION_FUNCTION<R, BOOST_FUNCTION_TEMPLATE_ARGS
00864                                    BOOST_FUNCTION_COMMA Allocator>
00865 {
00866   typedef BOOST_FUNCTION_FUNCTION<R, BOOST_FUNCTION_TEMPLATE_ARGS
00867                                   BOOST_FUNCTION_COMMA Allocator> base_type;
00868   typedef function self_type;
00869 
00870   struct clear_type {};
00871 
00872 public:
00873   typedef typename base_type::allocator_type allocator_type;
00874 
00875   function() : base_type() {}
00876 
00877   template<typename Functor>
00878   function(Functor f
00879 #ifndef BOOST_NO_SFINAE
00880            ,typename enable_if_c<
00881                             (boost::type_traits::ice_not<
00882                           (is_integral<Functor>::value)>::value),
00883                        int>::type = 0
00884 #endif
00885            ) :
00886     base_type(f)
00887   {
00888   }
00889 
00890 #ifndef BOOST_NO_SFINAE
00891   function(clear_type*) : base_type() {}
00892 #endif
00893 
00894   function(const self_type& f) : base_type(static_cast<const base_type&>(f)){}
00895 
00896   function(const base_type& f) : base_type(static_cast<const base_type&>(f)){}
00897 
00898   self_type& operator=(const self_type& f)
00899   {
00900     self_type(f).swap(*this);
00901     return *this;
00902   }
00903 
00904   template<typename Functor>
00905 #ifndef BOOST_NO_SFINAE
00906   typename enable_if_c<
00907                             (boost::type_traits::ice_not<
00908                          (is_integral<Functor>::value)>::value),
00909                       self_type&>::type
00910 #else
00911   self_type&
00912 #endif
00913   operator=(Functor f)
00914   {
00915     self_type(f).swap(*this);
00916     return *this;
00917   }
00918 
00919 #ifndef BOOST_NO_SFINAE
00920   self_type& operator=(clear_type*)
00921   {
00922     this->clear();
00923     return *this;
00924   }
00925 #endif
00926 
00927   self_type& operator=(const base_type& f)
00928   {
00929     self_type(f).swap(*this);
00930     return *this;
00931   }
00932 };
00933 
00934 #undef BOOST_FUNCTION_PARTIAL_SPEC
00935 #endif // have partial specialization
00936 
00937 } // end namespace boost

00950 #undef BOOST_FUNCTION_VOID_FUNCTION_REF_INVOKER
00951 #undef BOOST_FUNCTION_MEMBER_INVOKER
00952 #undef BOOST_FUNCTION_VOID_MEMBER_INVOKER

00954 #undef BOOST_FUNCTION_GET_FUNCTION_OBJ_INVOKER
00955 #undef BOOST_FUNCTION_GET_FUNCTION_REF_INVOKER
00956 #undef BOOST_FUNCTION_GET_MEMBER_INVOKER
